node.title: Firebite is a TV series about Indigenous vampire hunters in outback Australia
node.alt: A man holds a wooden stake.
node.description: Acclaimed Indigenous filmmaker Warwick Thornton'sÂ latest work is a television series that re-imagines the colonisation of Australia.
node.content:
["Acclaimed Indigenous filmmaker Warwick Thornton is no stranger to making confronting and thought-provoking movies about the obstacles faced by First Nations people.\u00a0", "His 2009 film Samson and Delilah told a story of poverty and oppression faced by two Indigenous teenagers.", "Thornton's latest work is a television series called Firebite. The plot is themed around colonisation in Australia, but this time he's used humour and vampires to get his message across.", "\"It's total rock and roll Australia, vampire-hunting madness, silly, stupid, idiotic, you know, with an undertone of incredibly important issues for Australia,\" he told 7.30.", "", "
Of his new TV series, Warwick Thornton says even he is \"surprised how good it is\".(Supplied: Barefoot Communications)
", "Thornton, who is listed as executive producer, co-creator, one of the directors, co-writer and director of photography for the show, said the idea came after he made a discovery about the First Fleet.", "\"It came out of anger in a strange way. I remember 10 years ago\u00a0reading that they brought 11 phials of smallpox on the First Fleet. And I was like argh, Australia Day, who brings smallpox to a barbecue? Bit bizarre to me, and thinking, how can I do something with that?\"", "Exactly how smallpox came to be in Australia in 1789 has long been a source of contention, with only patchy historical records to draw from.", "For Firebite, Thornton decided to\u00a0turn the disease into 11 vampires, sent by Britain to deal with Indigenous populations and take the land. More than two centuries later, the last of the vampire colony lives underground in a remote opal-mining town. It's up to two Indigenous vampire hunters to kill them off and save their people.", "", "
Shantae Barnes-Cowan in a scene from Firebite.(Supplied)
", "\"Vampires like black blood, it's quite pure and it's got some good stuff in it that makes them quite high. So it's, you know, it's bullshit. It's turning fact into fiction and kicking in the door, turning up the amp and rocking out,\" he told 7.30.", "Thornton knows some people might baulk at the messaging, but the overarching concept was to deliver a high-octane action fantasy series, laced with humour.", "\"Take it or leave it, how you want to manage it. It's educational. It's entertainment, you can watch a bunch of blackfellas kill vampires or you can read an undertone into it,\" he told 7.30.", "
Coober Pedy the 'perfect place' for vampires
", "", "
Yael Stone plays a vampire queen living in the fictional outback mining town of Opal City.(Supplied)
", "Thornton co-created the series with long-time friend Brendan Fletcher. Fletcher said the series was also about the relationship between the two lead characters, Tyson and Shanika,\u00a0the vampire hunters.", "\"At the heart of it, it's a family story. Tyson is a kind of father figure to Shanika, whose parents were killed by vampires.", "\"Their relationship is the heart of the film, the heart of the show,\" he told 7.30.", "Rob Collins and Shantae Barnes-Cowan play Tyson and Shanika.", "Callan Mulvey from Avengers: Endgame and the Australian series Underbelly, and Yael Stone, from Orange is the New Black, play the vampire king and queen.", "Fletcher said the series was made and put together in South Australia and featured an all-Australian music soundtrack.\u00a0", "\"We shot this series in Coober Pedy where there are a quarter of a million abandoned mining shafts, which is the perfect place for vampires to set up, you know, a dungeon and\u00a0a kind of underground colony.", "\"Then we can come back here to the Adelaide studios and we can book out the stages, we can do big construction, we can do post [production]\u00a0here, we can do sound mixing, we can do all the visual effects we need. So, you know, for us it was, it was a no-brainer, really.\u00a0", "\"South Australia is a bit of a one-stop shop. So it's been a pleasure,\" he said.", "
Show to screen internationally
", "", "
Callan Mulvey plays a vampire king in Firebite.(Supplied)
", "Not only are Thornton and Fletcher hoping to win over Australian audiences, Firebite will screen worldwide after being picked up by American cable network AMC.", "\"There's this new hunger for Indigenous storytelling. We've been saying this for 10-20 years, that there is a hunger around the world for Indigenous storytelling,\" Thornton said.", "\"It was fantastic that AMC recognised that and green-lit this.\u00a0I'm surprised how good it is. I was completely shitting myself, you know, on day one of the shoot.", "\"We've written this most insane show ... and we pulled it off, we got it right.\"", "Fletcher said he was not surprised AMC picked up the unique series.", "\"They made Walking Dead, yet they also made Breaking Bad and they also made Mad Men, so they have a kind of history of big genre shows.\u00a0", "\"Their shows are also complex ... they're not afraid of darkness, they're not afraid of being confronted.\"", "When asked if there would be a season two, Thornton said it would go for as long as there was an appetite for it.", "\"There'll be season five. By then we'll be all like, 'Let's not make this anymore. It's terrible.' You know, it's designed for about three seasons. That's the way it's set up.", "\"Then again, the Americans might say now, 'We don't like it.'\"", "Firebite premieres on AMC+ on Thursday December 16."]
